tagline.title: BALI BESAKIH AND PENGLIPURAN TOUR IS ONE DAY TOUR FOR ENJOY VISITING MOTHER TEMPLE OF BESAKIH AND ANCIENT VILLAGE OF PENGLIPURAN
tagline.text: BALI BESAKIH AND PENGLIPURAN TOUR IS ONE DAY TOUR FOR ENJOY VISITING MOTHER TEMPLE OF BESAKIH AND ANCIENT VILLAGE OF PENGLIPURAN
tagline.html: BALI BESAKIH AND PENGLIPURAN TOUR IS ONE DAY TOUR FOR ENJOY VISITING MOTHER TEMPLE OF BESAKIH AND ANCIENT VILLAGE OF PENGLIPURAN

description.text: Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour is a Bali Full Day Tour Package to visiting the largest temple and the mother of temples in Bali, namely Besakih Temple and continuing to visit an ancient village where the buildings are still preserved as they were in ancient times. A very good combination tour where we can see the oldest and largest temple in Bali and see ancient villages from ancient times which are still preserved today, suitable for those of you who want to know more about the religion and culture of the people in Bali. First, our tour driver will pick you up at the place where you are staying and go straight to the first tourist destination, namely Kerta Gosa, a building which functions as a place for discussions about the current security situation, justice and prosperity for the Klungkung kingdom, followed by visiting Pura Besakih which is a mother temple and the largest on the island of Bali which has 1 central temple and 18 accompanying temples, continue to the restaurant to enjoy delicious Indonesian food for lunch, after lunch the journey continues to Kehen Temple which is an ancient temple dedicated to worshiping Dewa Hyang Api or God of Fire, continued visiting Penglipuran Village, an ancient village whose house buildings and courtyard architecture are still as natural as they were in ancient times. After that, our tour driver will take you back to the hotel with a very impressive experience on a one day tour to visit the mother temple of Besakih and the ancient traditions of Penglipuran village, accompanied by an experienced and friendly tour driver who will make the this Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour is going to be a lot of fun

title.title: Kerta Gosa Ancient Justice Court Palace | Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour
title.text: Kerta Gosa Ancient Justice Court Palace
title.html: Kerta Gosa Ancient Justice Court Palace

image.title: Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour | Kerta Gosa Ancient Justice Court Palace | Bali Golden Tour

description.text: Kerta Gosa is first site we will visit during Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour, The Kerta Gosa Pavilion is a Balinese architectural building located at Klungkung Palace, Klungkung Regency, Bali, Indonesia. The Kertha Gosa Pavilion was built in the early 18th century by Dewa Agung Gusti Sideman. The purpose of building Kerta Gosa is as a place for discussion about the current security situation, justice and prosperity for the Klungkung kingdom. Or now a system like this is called the Court which is to provide a sense of justice and comfort for the residents of the Klungkung kingdom. Kerta gosa during the colonial era was also used as a courthouse in 1908 - 1942, where this can be seen from the equipment of this kerta gosa building such as chairs, tables and others with carvings and decorated with gold paint (prada)

title.title: Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour | Besakih Temple

image.title: Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour | Besakih Temple | Bali Golden Tour

description.text: Besakih Temple is second site we will visit during Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour, is a temple complex located in Besakih Village, Rendang District, Karangasem Regency, Bali, Indonesia. The Besakih Temple complex consists of 1 central temple and 18 accompanying temples. Besakih Temple was built in 1284 by Rsi Markandeya who was a Hindu religious leader of Indian descent. Rsi Markandeya built Besakih Temple because he heard supernatural sounds while meditating on the Dieng Plateau. The name Besakih is taken from Sanskrit, wasuki or in Old Javanese basuki which means safe. Besakih Temple is a tourist destination full of historical significance from religion and culture which was developed a long time ago and still stands and is used for the main purpose, namely religious ceremonies.
description.html: Besakih Temple is second site we will visit during Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour, is a temple complex located in Besakih Village, Rendang District, Karangasem Regency, Bali, Indonesia. Rsi Markandeya built Besakih Temple because he heard supernatural sounds while meditating on the Dieng Plateau. The name Besakih is taken from Sanskrit, wasuki or in Old Javanese basuki which means safe. Besakih Temple is a tourist destination full of historical significance from religion and culture which was developed a long time ago and still stands and is used for the main purpose, namely religious ceremonies.

title.title: Kehen Temple | Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour

image.title: Kehen Temple  | Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour | Bali Golden Tour

description.text: Kehen Temple is third site we will visit during Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour, is a Hindu temple located in Cempaga Village, Bangli District, Bangli Regency, Bali, Indonesia, about 45 km from the center of Denpasar City. This temple is located at an altitude of 483 meters above sea level, precisely at the southern foot of Bangli Hill. Because it is located at a height, this temple has a very charming view. Pura Hyang Api where kehen in Balinese means fire. If studied etymologically, in subsequent developments, the name Hyang Api contained in the first inscription became Hyang Kehen in the third inscription and then became Kehen Temple today, then this means that Kehen Temple existed in the Saka years between 804 - 836 (between 882 - 914 AD). The unique thing is that it uses Candi Kurung in front, while Candi Bentar is in the middle.
description.html: Kehen Temple is third site we will visit during Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour, is a Hindu temple located in Cempaga Village, Bangli District, Bangli Regency, Bali, Indonesia, about 45 km from the center of Denpasar City. This temple is located at an altitude of 483 meters above sea level, precisely at the southern foot of Bangli Hill. Because it is located at a height, this temple has a very charming view. Pura Hyang Api where kehen in Balinese means fire. If studied etymologically, in subsequent developments, the name Hyang Api contained in the first inscription became Hyang Kehen in the third inscription and then became Kehen Temple today, then this means that Kehen Temple existed in the Saka years between 804 - 836 (between 882 - 914 AD). The unique thing is that it uses Candi Kurung in front, while Candi Bentar is in the middle.

title.title: Penglipuran Village | Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour

image.title: Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour | Penglipuran Village | Bali Golden Tour

description.text: Penglipuran Village is fourth site we will visit during Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour, is one of the traditional villages of Bangli Regency, Bali Province, Indonesia. Penglipuran village is famous as one of the tourist destinations in Bali because its people still practice and preserve traditional Balinese culture in their daily lives. The building architecture and land management still follow the Tri Hita Karana concept, the Balinese philosophy regarding the balance of relationships between God, humans and the environment, if you enter the village it feels like you have returned to ancient times. Penglipuran village received several awards, in 1995 received the Kalpataru award from the Indonesian government for its efforts to protect bamboo forests in their local ecosystem and on 2023 received the Best Tourism Village award by UN Tourism
description.html: Penglipuran Village is fourth site we will visit during Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour, is one of the traditional villages of Bangli Regency, Bali Province, Indonesia. price.title: Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour Price :
price.content:
Bali Besakih and Penglipuran Tour Price :

The tour we provide is Based on Private Tour, We offer two price you can choose which is Regular Tours Price and Inclusive Tours Price, Please see below the details of Besakih Tour Packages price :

Regular Tours Price :

IDR 650,000/car ( 1 till 6 person included)
IDR 950,000/minibus ( 1 till 12 person included)
IDR 1,250,000/minibus ( 1 till 17 person included)
IDR 2,500,000/bus ( 1 till 30 person included)
Inclusion : Private Car / Minibus / Bus with Good A/C + Petrol + English Speaking Driver
Note : Parking Fee, Entrance fee and Lunch is not include in the price

Or

Inclusive Tours Price :

IDR 800,000/person
Note : For Inclusive Price is minimun Booking 2 Person
Inclusion : Private Car / Minibus / Bus with Good A/C + Petrol + Parking Fee + English Speaking Driver + Entrance Fee + Lunch Indonesian Food + Mineral Water

inclusion:
Seminyak, Legian, Kuta, Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Pecatu, Sanur, Ubud, Canggu, Denpasar, Benoa Harbour, Airport
Please contact us for pick up in different area

• The price already include with 21% Government tax and Services
  • Get special price for group booking
  • Regular Tours Price : is a Bali day tours price without include lunch and entrance fee, you need to pay by your own self
  • Inclusive Tours Price : is a Bali day tours price with include lunch and entrance fee
  • The tour is Private Tours, means there is no other participant, just only you and your companion
  • The Tour will assist by English Speaking Tours Driver
  • Tour Guide can be requested, contact us if you want to request Tour Guide during the trip
  • Time and Tourism site is subject to change based on your request.
  • Use contact form provide to send us message, asking information or make tour booking request.

• Payment is Cash Payment
  • Payment is on the day itself with our driver
  • Payment with other currency will convert based on daily exchange rate
